title: Need better typeface
content:
A friend of mine is getting tatted up. She wants to get a certain word in a script font. I suggested a few, she came back with

Freebooter - [http://www.dafont.com/freebooter-script.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.dafont.com/freebooter-script.font "http://www.dafont.com/freebooter-script.font")

I want to suggest to her a more professional version of this. This feels pretty cheap.

Any suggestions?
author: hullcrushdepth

comments.content:
I'd love to see a woman with a tat made from this:  
 [http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000181](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000181 "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000181")

Personally, I am partial to Linotype's [Zapfino Variants](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.linotype.com/1175/zapfino-family.html), Zapfino Two might be a good fit.

TypeSetIt's [Passions Conflict](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.typesetit.com/passion.html) might also be an appropriate choice :)

Freebooter is very shaky – inconsistent weights and heights and at base poorly drawn, (it has recently been a bane).  
You could also look at  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ariston](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ariston "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ariston")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-zaner/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-zaner/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-zaner/")

Or, my choice, hand-drawn.

Tim

Thinking about it more, I guess it depends in part on the word she plans on getting inscribed.

A fun choice if she likes the gothic look of Blackletter fonts might be [Ardenwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.fontcraft.com/Merchant2/merchant.mv?Screen=PROD&Product_Code=ardenwood)

Have a look at the Script fonts at Wilton Foundry  
 [http://fontselect.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/fontselect.com/ "http://fontselect.com/")

For a tattoo I'd go with Porcelain (with some minor hand tweaking) by Eduardo Recife.  
 [http://www.misprintedtype.com/v3/fonts.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222312/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/v3/fonts.php "http://www.misprintedtype.com/v3/fonts.php")
Fair crack of the whip, I did freebooter fairly quickly and rough, i'd not done nothing like this before and it was a learning experience. Why do you think its free

\>Why do you think its free

I have nothing against people creating, showing or giving away their learning experiences, unfortunately a client saw it and wanted to use it for some window vinyls and frankly it wasn’t good enough at that kind of scale.

Tim
I agree, it is really just a plaything and not a serious work.
If it's a good tat shop, shouldn't someone there should be well versed in freehand scripts themselves?
Tim, just a question. What do you mean "it has recently been a bane". I know the problems with the choice in regard to this thread, but in what other way. recently, did it affect you ?

The window vinyls I mentioned above, a client saw and chose the typeface, when I saw it I realised that I would need to redraw the characters, not so bad, but the client came back and wanted new vinyls within a tight lead-time.

Tim
